info.name: Opal to Legacy
info.description:
This probably needs to be managed in git. Adding to the other collections in the postman directory in the `opal-fines-service`

Test scenarios for intial legacy testing (commenced 27/08/2025) located here:

[Legacy Testing Spreadsheet](https://cgigbr-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/personal/cade_faulkner_cgi_com/Documents/Opal/Legacy%20Testing/Legacy%20Testing%2027-08-2025/Legacy%20testing.xlsx?d=w10b81b65e37d4faa87560febbda1e630&csf=1&web=1&e=5vzn5x)

The root folder which contains this run and the evidences can be found [here.](https://cgigbr-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/cade_faulkner_cgi_com/Documents/Opal/Legacy%20Testing?csf=1&web=1&e=hhObZt)

This collection works by getting the tokens for `opal-test`, `opal-test-6` and `opal-test-10`. It then creates draft accounts based on the scenarios defined in the spreadsheet using the `postDraftAccount` api, following that it promotes them to defendant accounts by setting the status to `'Publish Pending'` using the `patchDraftAccount` api.

If the application is in `legacy` mode these will be sent to the configured legacy environment.

If the application is in `opal` mode these will hit the opal stored procs and inserted into the opal database.

The `env_url`can be configured in the variables tab, within this collection.

The `draft_account_ids`and the `defendant_account_ids` (assuming successful creation) can also be seen in the variables tab, these are automatically updated for each run, by the corresponding test.

This collection is intened to create new accounts each time, not update or publish already existing accounts.

If testing locally, pointing to the JCDE 'internet security' will need to be disabled in Zscaler
